intro: Estate Planning is the process of planning the distribution of your estate (your belongings)

subtopics.par: For each account that you have, you should have designated beneficiaries
list: Primary Beneficiaries - receives everything the account has, should the account holder die or become incapacitated.
Contingent/Secondary - who gets it in case something happens to primary or primary beneficiary dies or becomes incapacitated.
Will (aka Living Will) - how you split up your assets when you pass away
If you have an adult child (who cannot be trusted to make responsible decisions) or a minor, then you must designate an Executer of the Estate to make decisions for you
If there are any minors in your will, then you must designate a guardian
Trusts - you make a trust (an independent legal entity) that owns all of your assets
Living Trust - while you are alive, you can take your own decisions
You assign a trustee, which is usually a bank
You assign an executer who will make decisions in your absence

subtopics.par: There a few other important people you must designate while estate planning:
list: Power of Attorney - you give someone to act on your behalf when you are not present
Healthcare Power of Attorney (aka Healthcare directive): same thing for healthcare related decisions in case you pass away or become incapacitated
